input_text:
Job Title: Director of Residential Operations

Location: Maple Grove, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Quality Assurance, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Put your heart to work at AbleLight! 

AbleLight is currently hiring Director Residential Operations for the MN market.

At AbleLight, we believe the world shines brighter when people with developmental disabilities achieve their full potential. We pioneer life-changing services that empower the people we serve to thrive.

In this position, the Director Residential Operations is to lead the team that delivers person centered care and services to those we support in a residential setting to fulfill our purpose for existing.

“We believe the world shines brighter when people with developmental disabilities achieve their full potential”.

 Requirements: 

 Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience required.  5-7 years of previous experience in a work position, volunteer/community role, or educational setting that focuses on serving and helping others.  5 plus years of leadership experience in a related field leading a dispersed team over a broad geography and proven success with market growth.  Experience with implementing and managing Group Home programs.  Ability to be flexible on hours and residential settings in your local community to assist colleagues and those we serve. 

 Benefits: 

We support the whole person and have designed our benefits with you and your family's total well-being in mind:

 Health and Wellness: Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits starting the first of the month following 30 days of employment and access to Teledoc.  Financial Wellness: 403(b) Retirement Savings Plan with 3.5% matching contributions, Health Savings Account, Flexible Savings Account, and Basic Life, AD&D, STD, and LTD insurance  Work/Life Balance: Paid Time Off (PTO), Tuition Reimbursements  Hybrid work environment with the ability to travel into the residential programs.  Mileage Reimbursement for travel between program sites.  We are now also offering Any Day Pay. With Dayforce Wallet, you get access to your pay as soon as you've earned it at no additional cost to you. 

 Responsibilities: 

 Talent, Leadership & Results: 

 As a leader of teams and individuals who lead others, ensures a culture that aligns the passion and talents of others to serve the people we support by actively developing others, empowering teams, promoting collaboration, removing barriers, achieving results, showing recognition and appreciation to attract and retain diverse talent.  Creates an environment where everyone can thrive.  In partnership with operational leaders, human resource, quality, and nursing: welcomes, onboards, and trains and mentor’s new leaders joining on the team and identify additional training and development needs for programs and leaders’ team as part of Quarterly Connections.  Maintains a focus on metrics and budget to positively support area and state business results.  Demonstrates positive leadership behaviors leading the way through individual behavior.  Be the resource for any colleague, person we support, or parent & guardian in the home if local leadership efforts to resolve a topic are not successful.  Bring recommendations forward related to quality and process improvements for our employees and those we serve to enhance standard operating procedures. 

 Growth  :

 Through strong and collaborative working relationships with colleagues, leadership, PWS and their parents and guardians, and corporate partners, develops plans that grow our residential services in their market and achieves our balanced scorecard results.  Ensures standard AbleLight operating procedures are followed to scale growth and achieve quality. 

 Community Relationship & Quality: 

 Seeks data from internal and external resources, participates in local community organizations, professional groups, and industry memberships to ensure the delivery of person-centered care and services to those we are blessed to serve.  Collaborates with the person we support, parents & guardians, external clinical or local/state representative & providers, internal partners in nursing and quality, and operational leadership.  Leverage our health information technology, human resource technology, and financial technology fully and ensures timely, comprehensive, and objective documentation.  Complete all individual training and development required by local, state, federal and AbleLight policies and procedures.  Ensures all related state and local regulations and expectations are implemented consistently across the homes in their area of accountability. 

 Be part of a team who enhances the lives of our individuals in every way possible. Apply today and make a difference in your community! 

BLC123

Apply Now

Experience Level (if available): Director
